item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. "Four Seconds to Hot Up the Disintegrator, Google Had Told Me It Wasn't Enough" (92 points | 29 comments)
2. Rio-labs/rio: WebApps in pure Python. No JavaScript, HTML and CSS needed (47 points | 34 comments)
3. The Centrality of Stupidity in Mathematics (103 points | 47 comments)
4. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (33 points | 9 comments)
5. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (81 points | 11 comments)
6. Signatures of Gravitational Atoms from Black Hole Mergers (57 points | 13 comments)
7. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (375 points | 63 comments)
8. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (3 points | discuss)
9. A Curried Composition Puzzle (41 points | 2 comments)
10. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (3 points | 1 comment)
11. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (40 points | 8 comments)
12. Advice on Reading Homer in Translation (19 points | 8 comments)
13. Tiny Trackers Are Revealing the Secret Lives of Birds (9 points | 3 comments)
14. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (13 points | 1 comment)
15. An interactive core memory electronic kit (12 points | 1 comment)
16. The Theft of a Priceless Churchill Portrait (27 points | 11 comments)
17. Show HN: Electrico – Electron Without Node and Chrome (Rust / Wry) (144 points | 57 comments)
18. Ncomm – A node-based robotics framework written in Rust (35 points | 12 comments)
19. Ask HN: Is a Masters in CS/Engineering worth it for a mid-career PM? (39 points | 55 comments)
20. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (11 points | 4 comments)
21. Chain of Thought empowers transformers to solve inherently serial problems (223 points | 144 comments)
22. Taxes on everyday Europeans bring in 13 times more revenue than taxes on wealth (9 points | 1 comment)
23. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (307 points | 137 comments)
24. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (7 points | 2 comments)
25. Why is it so hard to go back to the moon? (7 points | 3 comments)
26. Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week (1338 points | 1576 comments)
27. Rainfrog – a database management TUI for Postgres (134 points | 36 comments)
28. Bionicle – my actual part in its origins (2015) (75 points | 18 comments)
29. A Spreadsheet and a Debugger Walk into a Shell (202 points | 11 comments)
30. Show HN: Franzelio – Draw lines, make music, share your instrument (108 points | 40 comments)
